pullRequest.title: [risk=medium][RW-4465][RW-4637]Enable requireInstitutionalVerification in Staging and Perf
pullRequest.bodyText:
Enable requireInstitutionalVerification in Staging and Perf
Disable requireInvitationKey in Test, Local, Perf, and Staging
Conservatively labeling "medium" risk because we're removing one barrier to access.  Mitigated by requiring another, which should be better security-wise.
Enable/disable Feature Flags: https://precisionmedicineinitiative.atlassian.net/browse/RW-4465
TODO: Stable, Prod
Remove Feature Flags: https://precisionmedicineinitiative.atlassian.net/browse/RW-4361
Description:


PR checklist

 This PR meets the Acceptance Criteria in the JIRA story
 The JIRA story has been moved to Dev Review
 This PR includes appropriate unit tests
 I have run and tested this change locally
 If this includes an API change, I have updated the appropriate Swagger definitions and notified API consumers
 If this includes a new feature flag, I have created and linked new JIRA tickets to (a) turn on the feature flag and (b) remove it later

commit.message:
Enable requireInstitutionalVerification in Staging
Disable requireInvitationKey in Test, Local, Perf, and Staging

nodes.bodyText: Welp.  The good thing about autoformatters is that they only run once.

FYI @aweng98 in case this flag flip might affect our perf tests at all. I think it's unlikely to be impacted, just wanted to check.
(My thought process is that perf tests may be impacted only if both of the following are true: (1) nightly perf tests are creating new users, and (2) our API returns an error response if an invitation key is provided bu requireInvitationKey is false. My quick read of this line is that we just ignore the invitation key when it's not required.
